key_insight: GateFusion uses a hierarchical gated fusion decoder to combine pretrained audio and visual encoders, enabling fine-grained cross-modal interactions that late fusion misses and substantially improves active speaker detection accuracy and robustness.
problem_solved: Overcomes limitations of late fusion that fail to capture fine-grained, layer-wise audio–visual interactions and temporal alignment, reducing errors in unconstrained videos with noisy or ambiguous cues.
method: Use strong pretrained unimodal encoders for audio and visual streams to extract rich features.
Introduce a Hierarchical Gated Fusion Decoder (HiGat) that fuses features at multiple levels with learnable gates to modulate cross-modal influence per layer and timestep.
Train the fusion module end-to-end (with frozen or lightly finetuned encoders) to produce temporally coherent active-speaker predictions.
impact: Provides a plug-and-play fusion module that boosts ASD performance and robustness in real-world videos, offering an easy upgrade path for audio–visual systems that need reliable speaker localization.
visual_elements: Architecture diagram: two pretrained encoders (audio, visual) feeding into a hierarchical gated fusion decoder with per-layer gates and final prediction head.
Timeline visualization: frame-by-frame predictions vs ground truth illustrating improved temporal alignment and fewer false positives.
Ablation chart: comparison of late fusion, early fusion, and GateFusion performance (accuracy / F1) across datasets.
Gate activation heatmap: per-layer gate weights showing when audio or visual modalities dominate.
paper_title: GateFusion: Hierarchical Gated Cross-Modal Fusion for Active Speaker Detection
paper_authors: Yu Wang, Juhyung Ha, Frangil M. Ramirez, Yuchen Wang, David J. Crandall
